intro: Marginaria piloselloides, commonly known as the hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are hairy and often have a serrated edge, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds.
